oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of Carl C. Larson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of Carl Clarence Larson in uniform and mounted on wood. Larson was born in Mazon, Ill. After receiving his B.S. in Chemistry from the University of Illinois in June 1918, he worked at the U.S. Army Water Supply Service's water analysis lab in St. Nazarre (France), with the rank of sergeant. He received his M.S. in Chemistry from U of I in 1921 and worked as a chemist for the Illinois Dept. of Public Health. In 1929, he became the chief chemist for the Springfield (Ill.) Sanitary District.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Larson, Carl C., 1895-1975
